story.text: MOGADISHU Somali Prime Minister Ali Mohamed Gedi said on Tuesday that Eritrean, Ethiopian rebel and Arab fighters were taken prisoner during the ousting of Islamists who held southern Somalia for six months."Yesterday, we have captured Eritreans, Oromo and Arab fighters," he said, referring to rebels from Ethiopia's Oromia region. "This is a clear sign foreign fighters are involved."
story.title: somalia says held foreign pro - islamist fighters
